DOC.brief_summary: The goal study examine effect postmenopausal woman one-year moderate intensity exercise intervention , compare sedentary pattern ( low-level stretch program ) , : serum estrogen , androgen , sex hormone bind globulin , insulin , triglyceride , glucose , aromatase , FSH , LH , well parameter body fat mass .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Exercise Sex Hormones Postmenopausal Women
DOC.criteria: Ages 5575 year first group meeting Physically able undertake moderate exercise program Sedentary activity pattern ( exercise < 2 times/week 20 minute level produce sweat ) Postmenopausal ( experience menstrual period previous 12 month FSH > 30 mIU/ml ; woman hysterectomy , FHS > 30 mIU/ml classify postmenopausal ) Body Mass Index ( BMI ) great 25.0 Able follow direction fill questionnaire , exercise diary log English Agrees randomly assign either exercise intervention control group Gives inform consent participate screening study activity Able come FHCRC clinic visit class , UW Medical Center CT scan , UW NETT measurement instruction Plans leave Western Washington within followup period Using hormone replacement , tamoxifen , oral contraceptive past 6 month Currently severe hot flash ( might prompt participant start hormone replacement therapy end study ) Current unstable thyroid disease unstable dose thyroid medication TSH > 5.0 IU/ml < 0.5 IU/ml Invasive cancer past 10 year ( except nonmelanotic skin cancer ) Any endocrinologic abnormality Breast , endometrial , ovarian , melanoma cancer carcinomainsitu time Morbidly obese ( BMI > 40 ) Current plan use corticosteroid Currently plan enter structure weight loss program take diet drug Current use certain medication , likely interfere adherence exercise program likely interfere study outcome Moderate high alcohol intake ( 2 drink per day ) Current smoker Diabetes mellitus ( fast hyperglycemia ) Abnormal screen lab ( hematocrit < 32 > 48 , white blood cell < 3.0 > 15.0 , potassium < 3.5 > 5.0 , fast glucose > 140 , creatinine > 2.0 ) , abnormalities screen physical judged study physician contraindicate participation exercise program Contraindications entry train program118 include : unstable angina , uncontrolled hypertension ( systolic > 200 , diastolic > 100 ) , orthostatic hypotension ( > 20 ) , moderate/severe aortic stenosis , uncontrolled arrhythmia , uncontrolled congestive heart failure , third degree heart block , pericarditis , myocarditis , pulmonary/systemic embolism within past 6 month , thrombophlebitis , ST displacement > 3 mm rest , history cardiac arrest ) Contraindications exercise testing118 include : recent ( within 6 month ) cardiac event ( MI , pulmonary edema , myocarditis , pericarditis ) , unstable angina , uncontrolled arrhythmia , third degree heart block , leave bundle branch block , acute congestive failure , recent ( within 6 month ) pulmonary/systemic embolus , severe electrolyte abnormality Meets criterion stop screen exercise test118 decide oversee physician ( Dr. Schwartz McTiernan ) volunteer order lose weight alcohol drug abuse , significant mental illness ( assess study staff impression )
